Tarif Curah Tak Berlaku saat Cas Mobil Listrik di SPKLU PLN
06 Nov 2019, 10:52 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/ Bisma Septalisma)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN) menetapkan tarif curah atau tarif pengisian dayaÂ mobil listrik Rp700 per kWh tak berlaku umum, sekali pun saat pengisian baterai mobil tanpa emisi di Stasiun Pengisian Kendaraan Listrik Umum (SPKLU) milik PLN.EVP Corporate Communication & CSR PLN I Made Suprateka mengatakan tarif curah itu hanya berlaku buat pihak kedua yang membangun sendiri SPKLU. Kemudian pihak kedua itu yang nanti menjual daya kepada pengusaha unit transportasi listrik."Iya, seperti sama Bluebird atau KAI juga tentunya curah," kata Made ditemui di kawasan SCBD, Jakarta Selatan, Selasa (5/11).Tarif curah ini merupakan tarif khusus yang diberikan penyedia listrik PLN buat badan usaha. Tarif ini diwacanakan sebagai bagian dari subsidi untuk mendukung berkembangnya populasi mobil listrik Indonesia."Jadi SPKLU PLN ya tarif normal nanti. Tidak bisa gunakan tarif curah karena regulasi per kWh harus dijaga," ucap Made.Saat ini PLN sedang mengembangkan 10 titik SPKLU untuk diletakkan di berbagai kota besar Indonesia. Di Jakarta sudah ada lima unit SPKLU yang terdiri dari medium charging dengan kapasitas 25 kW, fast charging 50 kW, dan ultra fast charging 125 kW.Gratis untuk penggunaan SPKLU masih berlaku hingga akhir Desember sebagai tahap 'promosi' kepada pengguna mobil listrik murni. Sedangkan ketentuan tarif pengisian masih digodok pemerintah melalui Kementerian Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM). Kementerian ESDM pernah menyebut perkiraan tarif pengisian listrik kendaraan Indonesia berkisar pada angka Rp1.650 hingga Rp2.450 per kWh. "Tapi saya belum tau kapan tarif keluar, tunggu dari kementerian. Jadi itu harus cermat, tidak boleh sembarangan. Supaya ini (aturan tarif) berfungsi dan bermanfaat untuk semua pihak," ungkap Made. (ryh/mik)

Bulk Tariffs Not Applicable when Electric Car Cas in PLN SPKLU
06 Nov 2019, 10:52 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Bisma Septalisma)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The State Electricity Company (PLN) sets a tariff for bulk or electric car charging tariffs of Rp700 per kWh not generally applicable, even when charging a car battery without emissions at PLN's Public Electric Vehicle Charging Station (SPKLU). EVP Corporate PLN Communication & CSR I Made Suprateka said the bulk tariffs were only valid for second parties who built SPKLU themselves. Then the second party will later sell the power to the electricity transportation unit entrepreneur. "Yes, like Bluebird or KAI, of course it is also bulk," said Made found in the SCBD area, South Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5). This bulk tariff is a special tariff provided by PLN electricity providers for business entities. This tariff is planned as part of subsidies to support the growth of Indonesia's electric car population. "So the PLN SPKLU is normal tariff later. Cannot use bulk tariffs because regulations per kWh must be maintained," said Made. Currently PLN is developing 10 SPKLU points to be placed in various major cities of Indonesia. In Jakarta there are five SPKLU units consisting of medium charging with a capacity of 25 kW, fast charging 50 kW, and ultra fast charging 125 kW. Free use of SPKLU is still valid until the end of December as a 'promotion' stage for pure electric car users. While the provision of charging rates is still being drafted by the government through the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM). The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has mentioned that the estimated tariff for charging Indonesian electric vehicles ranges from Rp1,650 to Rp2,450 per kWh. "But I don't yet know when the tariff will come out, wait for it from the ministry. So it must be careful, it should not be arbitrary. In order for this (tariff rules) to function and benefit all parties," Made said. (ryh / mic)
